alert.note: Alert for Rush (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 8:22PM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Indiana and southeast Indiana, including the following counties, in central Indiana, Bartholomew, Decatur, Hancock, Rush and Shelby. In southeast Indiana, Jennings. * WHEN...Until midnight EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indianapolis, Columbus, Shelbyville, Lawrence, Greenfield, Greensburg, North Vernon, Rushville, Vernon, Adams, Cumberland, McCordsville, Edinburgh, Fortville, Knightstown, Hope, New Palestine, Flat Rock, Milford and Westport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
